greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Maximal exponent of x in all terms of Somos polynomial of order n.
comment: This sequence differs from A001840 only in four terms preceding it. That is, A001840(n) = a(n+5).
Let b(n) = 2^a(n+1). Then b(1)=b(2)=b(3)=b(4)=1 and b(n)*b(n-4) = b(n-1)*b(n-3) + c(n)*b(n-2)^2, c(3*n)=2, c(3*n+1)=c(3*n+2)=1 for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Oct 18 2018
formula: a(n) = 1 + a(n-1) + a(n-3) - a(n-4) for all n in Z.
a(n) = a(7-n) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Oct 18 2018
mathematica: a[ n_] := Quotient[ Binomial[n - 3, 2], 3]; (* _Michael Somos_, Oct 18 2018 *)
program: (Sage) [floor(binomial(n,2)/3) for n in range(-2,59)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Dec 01 2009
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 11 2001
ext: G.f. proposed by Maksym Voznyy checked and corrected by _R. J. Mathar_, Sep 16 2009
